alert.note: Alert for Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 3:47AM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois... Mississippi River from Dubuque downstream to Burlington Iowa, affecting all counties bordering the Mississippi River. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Le Claire LD14. * WHEN...From late Friday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Water affects riverside parking lots in Port Byron and Le Claire. Water affects Canal Shore Drive in Le Claire. Water is at the foundations of a few houses at the downstream end of Hampton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Saturday morning and continue rising to 14.1 feet Wednesday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
